column4: You mentioned your laptop broke? Do you need help with something buddy?
Is there option on your screen, a button to adjust resolution? That could fix it.
Awesome ;)
I might help you, I've used emulators.
Look online for Zsnes emulator. And I'm not sure if even NES ROM would work, since I think it's meant for NES games not SNES.
sudo apt-get update, sudo apt-get install zsnes
http://www.zsnes.com/
You need to compile it.
You sure there isn't zsnes in repositories, since I typed sudo apt-get install zsnes, it showed right away.
dr_willis: I have 32 bit, and it can install here too.
Go to software sources, Ubuntu software tab, and check all there.
Change "download from" to different server.
Did you change the server from software sources and tried to download it? Please post results here.
TRy this, go to software sources, other software tab, and check independent repositories if they aren't.
Check those independent from other sources, than sudo apt-gte update from terminal and try to install now.
You're missing repositories I guess.
Yes. You just need to add those missing repositories. I'll help you, let me check.
Go to software sources, other software tab, add source: deb http://extras.ubuntu.com/ubuntu quantal main
Do sudo apt-get update
Go to that extracted zsnes download with terminal cd /location of zsnes/ than go to src, cd src, than "sudo ./configure", "sudo make", "sudo make install"
sudo apt-get install nasm. And try to compile again zsnes.
